group_1.narration: Lady Himena and her friends suddenly disappeared@without a trace, as per usual, but...
I am sure we will meet again next year.
As they have done so in the past!
Meanwhile...@We are steadily preparing for our next project.
Though in our free time, we also enjoy playing Ludus...

group_1.textLeft: Hwah...! I can't roll "one" no matter what!
What's going on with these dice?
How is it possible for the dice to be so skewed?

group_1.textRight: It's true that it doesn't happen very often.
I'm still far behind, so I'm going to@move on anyway.

group_1.textLeft: It's so strange...@Just now I was unilaterally leading...
What an ominous turn of affairs...
Whaaaaaa...?! Again!
The Goddess of Fortune has abandoned me...!

group_1.textRight: Ah... A good roll. I think I can catch up.

group_1.textLeft: The dice are on your side, Lady Cornelia,@aren't they?
I haven't been able to move my pieces very well@since some time ago...

group_1.textRight: In that situation, you're at a disadvantage@because you're relying on luck.
Maybe it's a matter of perspective,
but wouldn't you have won if you had placed your@pieces here and here on your sixth previous turn?

group_1.textLeft: What...
Lady Cornelia,
how do you even remember your opponent's@dice rolls from so many turns ago?

group_1.textRight: I was carefully paying attention, wondering@"How would I have put it if it were me?"...

group_1.textLeft: The worlds we see are too different...
Even though I am the one who taught you Ludus...
It feels like I have raised a lion cub
while thinking it was a cat...

group_1.textRight: *Chuckle*...

group_1.textLeft: Is there something funny...?

group_1.textRight: If I remember correctly, Amaryllis...
You told me it was "The Art of Love" that piqued@your interest in Ludus, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that's true...

group_1.textRight: So, I've read it too, and...
The lesser matter is how to use the throws to@your advantage.
It's a task of greater consequence to remain@graceful and never expose your emotions...
...That's what it said.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:105301:effect_emotion_sad_0][se:7224_fall_into]That's the complete opposite of how I play!

group_1.textRight: Right? That's what I thought...

group_1.textLeft: ...Yeah.
The great Ovidius is introducing board games as@an opportunity for love.
Rather than being so hung up on winning@and losing, as I am,
what he recommended was a more graceful@way of playing...
Just like yours, Lady Cornelia...
When did I forget his maxim and begin playing@with the exact opposite approach?

group_1.textRight: ...Maybe it's your nature to get carried away easily?

group_1.textLeft: It's like that with chariot races, too...
Ovid introduced that activity merely as a place to@meet people and build rapport,
yet all I ever do there is cheering for my favourite charioteer.
...It's a total defeat.
Not only don't I understand how to triumph@in Ludus,
but I don't even know how to indulge in@amusement the way you do.

group_1.textRight: That's fine, don't you think?@I like it when you have fun.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, thank you so much...
...But even so, you are always so composed,@Lady Cornelia.
When Lady Miyurin lost her phone,
you also handled the incident in a calm and@graceful manner...

group_1.textRight: It wasn't me who came up with the strategy,@was it?

group_1.textLeft: It is true that it was Hiko who came up@with the idea.
Without your advice to calm down and@sort out the course of action,
I would have been in a panic and could not@have done anything...
Lady Cornelia...
Even your manner of walking is the@picture of "stately".
I suppose some people simply have more@refinement than others.

group_1.textRight: ...For your information, I fall flat on my face after@running a scant three paces.
Which explains why I try not to run at all.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:105301:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What?! Is THAT how it is?

group_1.textRight: Junia also tends to be subject to pratfalls.@Twins will be twins, I suppose.

group_1.textLeft: Ah... You may be on to something there...
What an endearing revelation!

group_1.textRight: A "calm temperament" is often understood to be@a good thing...
But one might also call it an excess of caution...@If not outright cowardice.
That's why, you know... I'm grateful to you.

group_1.textLeft: Huh...me?

group_1.textRight: Yes, you.

group_1.textLeft: What are you thanking me for, Lady Cornelia?
I've done nothing to earn your gratitude...

group_1.textRight: That's not true... Without the push you gave me,
I would've remained ignorant of the pleasure@of Ludus.
On top of that, I would have never been on@the board...
...of the game of Love, would I?

group_1.textLeft: Lady Cornelia...!
